Figure 12: Scatterplot a) (top right) is generated from the demo imagery (top left). Scatterplots b) to d) (bottom left) are generated from the corresponding cropped areas. Scatterplots e) to g) are generated by extracting the scatter points from a) that are found in the corresponding cropping windows which generate scatterplots b) to d).

Figure 14: a) The Eigenvectors of the scatterplot are computed using 100% of the pixel vectors. b) The Eigenvectors of the scatterplot are computed from 75% of the pixel vectors. The other 25% are projected onto the scatterplot by dot-product. c) The Eigenvectors of the scatterplot are computed from 50% of the pixel vectors. The other 50% are projected by dot-product.
Figure 13: An illustration of our multiple sliding window design in visualizing data streams.
